text: it was unbelievably quick he was
absolutely fine
he came home from a concert he'd gone to
a bone bleed to see the Pink Floyd in
concert he came home he had his Sunday
dinner
he ate full roast dinner didn't say he
felt poorly and he he we had friends
over we chatted in the afternoon said he
needed pots and pans for university
because he just got amazing grades to go
to Warwick University and he was on the
front page of The Times with his
academic results and he was so happy and
then suddenly felt started feeling 6:30
in the evening he phoned me is he
worried he was in his room he phoned me
and he just said ma'am I feel cold can I
have something too hot to eat and I took
him cheese on toast we went down there
mark my husband was there and he said
his feet felt cold and we gave him the
slippers and he put the heating on and
the next thing we knew was at 11:30 at
night he had a headache I went in and
gave him some paracetamol and he said
ma'am I just need to get to sleep and I
said yes you do you just need to get to
sleep 2:30 rang me he said he felt sick
I gave him a bowl and he was sick I said
what did you eat at the concert and he
said a dodgy chicken kebob and then
eventually you got a doctor out he went
to hospital but the end came horribly
quickly called the doctor at 4:30 he was
rushed to the hospital
he got hospital at 7:20 in the morning
dead by 10 o'clock absolutely
devastating for him
unbelievable unbelievable did you know
anything about this meningitis w when it
happened did you ever even heard of it
nope never heard of it I didn't know the
symptoms I thought the signs were things
like a rash and bright light he had none
of that he didn't have the brush brush
cold feet is a real cold hands and cold
feet I think it's a real symptom that
needs to
pushed but the speed is so quick I'm
